page.title: 17Stop Digging in Jersey
page.content: The States of Jersey are telling the farmers to stop digging potatoes. Why? Because the potatoes we ship abroad go to the English markets to sell; but if we export too many potatoes in one go, the English markets will not be able to sell them all and they will have to sell them cheaply to get rid of them. The farmers will lose money. So it is better to export a steady flow of potatoes. Although it may seem silly to stop the farmers digging with lots of potatoes in the fields, it is better for the farmers later on because it is better to have a steady price throughout the season than a couple of good weeks followed by a disaster.
